H-0184.1
HOUSE BILL 1026
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Abbarno, Schmick, Burnett, Jacobsen, Eslick, and McClintock
Prefiled 12/10/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Early Learning & Human Services.
AN ACT Relating to protecting spouses by allowing the sharing of benefits under the long-term services and supports trust program; and adding a new section to chapter 50B.04 RCW.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. A new section is added to chapter 50B.04 RCW to read as follows:
(1) A qualified individual may elect to transfer any or all of the qualified individual's available benefit units to the qualified individual's spouse if the receiving spouse:
(a)(i) Does not meet the criteria to be a qualified individual under RCW 50B.04.050; and
(ii) Following an evaluation, is determined to meet the functional criteria necessary to become an eligible beneficiary as established in RCW 50B.04.060; or
(b)(i) Has met the criteria to be a qualified individual under RCW 50B.04.050;
(ii) Following an evaluation, is determined to meet the functional criteria necessary to become an eligible beneficiary as established in RCW 50B.04.060; and
(iii) Has exhausted the benefit units available to the receiving spouse under the program.
(2) A qualified individual who transfers benefit units to a spouse shall have the amount of transferred units deducted from the amount of benefit units available to the qualified individual who makes the transfer.
--- END ---
1026.summary:
Purpose

The purpose of House Bill 1026 is to enhance the protection of spouses by enabling them to share benefits from the long-term services and supports trust program. This bill introduces provisions that allow individuals to transfer their available benefit units to their spouse under specific conditions. The key change from the previous version is the addition of this transfer mechanism, which aims to provide greater financial support options for families facing long-term care needs.

Key Provisions

Benefit Transfer Eligibility

  • A qualified individual may transfer any or all of their available benefit units to their spouse if:
    • The receiving spouse does not meet the qualification criteria as outlined in RCW 50B.04.050.
    • The receiving spouse, after evaluation, is determined to meet the necessary functional criteria as specified in RCW 50B.04.060.
  • Alternatively, if the receiving spouse has met the qualified individual criteria:
    • They must also be evaluated and found to meet the functional criteria for eligibility.
    • Additionally, the receiving spouse must have exhausted their benefit units under the program.

Transfer Impact

  • The benefit units that are transferred to the spouse will be deducted from the original qualified individual's available units.
